de.bit.pl02.pp5.task02

Class CommandLineInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.bit.pl02.pp5.task02.CommandLineInterface

  • public class CommandLineInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    The class CommandLineInterface provides an interface for the user and helps to interact. With this, it is possible to create a database on the basis of the directory given by the user. This directory should contain image files (.png, .jpg or .jpeg) and corresponding metadata files (.txt). The user can query the database by giving the name of the author or title to retrieve an image or additional metadata information.
    Author:
    Shreya Kapoor, Sophia Krix, Gemma van der Voort

      • option_s

        public static void option_s(Database Db)

        Parameters:
        Db - the name of the database you want to connect to

      • check_duplicates

        public static boolean check_duplicates(java.lang.String dir,
                                       java.lang.String name)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Checks if the files from a given directory have been entered in the database
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory that has been saved to the database
        name - the name of the database
        Returns:
        boolean true if a duplicated directory in database, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem with dealing with the checkfile

      • addDbToAllowedDb

        public static void addDbToAllowedDb(java.lang.String name)
        Adds name of a database created by the user to the list of allowed databases, in file allowedDBs.txt in the task02 folder. Only those databases are allowed to be queried and added to by the API users. This functionality is intended to prevent API users from making their own databases due to typo's, whereby they clutter the server that this application is running on and upload their images to the wrong database.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the database

                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
